articles.author: Prathmesh barot
articles.description:
Announcing Razen v0.1.695: Streamlining the Language and Supercharging Error Handling üöÄ (Beta)


Hey Dev.to fam! üëã
I‚Äôm thrilled to share a new milestone for Razen, the programming language I‚Äôve been passionately developing. We‚Äôve just released v0.1.695, now in Beta, focused on making Razen leaner, more reliable, and developer-friendly ‚Äî especially when it comes to error handling and library support.
Razen is still early-stage but rapidly evolving. The Beta status means:
The core syntax and libraries are mostly stable, ready for serious exploration
We‚Äôre actively gathering community feedback to shape future features
Some APIs and tokens are still in flux (like the recent token removals), aiming for a clean, maintainable language
If you like being on the cutting edge, diving into language ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Razen Programming Language beta v0.1.695

These tools go beyond basic automation ‚Äî they can detect edge cases, write test scripts, debug in real time, and even suggest fixes or improvements. In this list, we‚Äôll explore the top 10 AI testing tools every modern developer should know.
Whether you're coding a quick prototype or managing a large-scale project, having the right AI assistant in your workflow can make a huge difference. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve put together this list of 20 must-try AI coding agents. From full-stack builders to browser automators and I‚Ä¶

articles.author: Aviral Srivastava
articles.description:
Rate Limiting & Throttling: Managing API Requests


Introduction:
Rate limiting and throttling are crucial mechanisms for managing the flow of requests to a system, especially APIs. They prevent overload and ensure fair access for all users. While often used interchangeably, they have subtle differences.  Rate limiting defines a specific number of requests allowed within a given time window, while throttling adjusts the rate dynamically based on system load.
Prerequisites:
Implementing rate limiting and throttling requires careful consideration of:
Request identification:  Unique identifiers (IP addresses, API keys) are needed to track request rates.
Time window: Defining the appropriate timeframe (e.g., per second, minute, hour) for counting requests.
Limit enforcement: Choosing a mechani‚Ä¶
articles.title: Rate Limiting & Throttling

articles.author: Hedy
articles.description:
Pipelining is a technique used in microprocessors(what is microprocessor?) to increase instruction throughput ‚Äî the number of instructions that can be executed in a given amount of time ‚Äî by overlapping the execution of multiple instructions.

Analogy: Assembly Line
Instead of building one car at a time from start to finish,
Different stations (like engine fitting, painting, testing) work
simultaneously on different cars.
Likewise, in pipelining:
Different stages of instruction execution are processed in parallel.
Basic Pipeline Stages

Example: Without vs With Pipelining

In pipelining, a new instruction enters the pipeline every clock cycle, so multiple instructions are being processed at once ‚Äî each in a different stage.
Advantages of Pipelining
 Higher throughput
 Better CPU performance
 Efficient use of CPU resources
Limitations / Hazards

Solutions include:
Forwarding, stalling, and branch prediction techniques.
Used In:
8086 (basic pipelining: Fetch + Execute)
Modern processors (ARM, x86) with deep pipelines (10+ stages)
Super-scalar and out-of-order execution
articles.title: What is pipelining in microprocessor?

articles.author: Manthan Ankolekar
articles.description:
As developers, we spend a lot of time installing packages. Whether it's a new framework, a handy utility, or a build tool, npm install is a command we type almost subconsciously. But how often do we stop to consider what's actually installed on our system or within our projects?
Knowing how to list your npm packages is more than just curiosity; it's a fundamental skill for debugging, understanding project dependencies, and maintaining a healthy development environment. Let's dive into the essential commands you need to master.
Before we get to the "how," let's quickly touch on the "why":
Debugging: Is your build failing? A conflicting package version might be the culprit. Listing packages helps you identify what's actually installed.
Auditing: Want to check if a specific package (or an out‚Ä¶
articles.title: Peeking Under the Hood: How to List Your npm Packages

articles.author: DC
articles.description:
AI in crypto has become the new normal. Every dApp tries to adopt some form of AI applicability to become cutting-edge and capture the imagination and attention of the public. DeFi has, as a result, evolved to DeFAI where AI agents have started taking center stage more and more. But what about trust while on-chain trading? Will it be verifiable? Oasis has the solution in WT3.

The BTS Tech Stack


The tech stack working behind the scenes to set up WT3 is singularly powered up.
Oasis Sapphire is the base for on-chain confidentiality, and the ROFL (runtime off-chain logic) framework is the component enabling computations that can be verified without on-chain dependency. This also benefits in ensuring decentralized key management.


Predictoor trading signals are integral to incorporate accur‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why WT3 is the Future of AI Agents? Trustlessness is Key

Edition #210 - May 2025


Welcome to issue #210 of the AWS open source newsletter, the newsletter where I try and provide you the best open source on AWS content.  As always, this edition has more great new projects to check out, which include: a couple of projects for those of you looking for tools that can help you with cost optimisation, a new security threat modelling tool that uses the power of generative AI, an experimental Python SDK that offers async support, a nice UI testing tool (that will warm your spirits), and of course the now obligatory collection of MCP projects - that said, don't miss those as I think you are going to love these, including some that have been contributed by a member of the AWS Community.
The projects will keep you busy until next month for sure, but we al‚Ä¶

articles.author: Destinova AI Labs
articles.description:
In today‚Äôs digitally driven economy, businesses are under constant pressure to meet growing customer expectations while staying efficient and competitive. One breakthrough technology reshaping the e-commerce landscape is the rise of AI agents‚Äîautonomous systems capable of managing complex tasks without human intervention. These intelligent agents are powering a new wave of automation, enhancing customer experiences, boosting operational efficiency, and streamlining logistics across the board.
Unlike traditional tools that rely heavily on manual input and supervision, AI agents think, learn, and act independently. They adapt in real time, making smarter decisions that save businesses both time and money.
1. Intelligent Customer Interaction
2. Real-Time Inventory Management
3. Streamlined Order Fulfillment
4. Smart Pricing Strategies
5. Personalized Product Recommendations
Advanced Chatbots with Decision-Making Skills
AI-Powered Virtual Store Managers
Visual Search Capabilities
Fraud Detection and Risk Mitigation
Cost Efficiency
Scalable Growth
Consistent Service Delivery
Real-Time Decision-Making
Adapting to Evolving Consumer Behavior
Managing Seasonal Traffic Peaks
Expanding Globally with Ease
AI agents aren‚Äôt just enhancing e-commerce‚Äîthey‚Äôre redefining it. By bringing automation, intelligence, and real-time adaptability to the forefront, they‚Äôre helping businesses deliver top-tier service while reducing operational burdens.
For brands aiming to thrive in an increasingly competitive digital market, adopting AI-powered solutions is no longer optional‚Äîit‚Äôs essential. At Destinova AI Labs, we‚Äôre leading this transformation with cutting-edge AI agents tailored specifically for e-commerce. Our mission is to equip businesses with the tools they need to scale smarter, serve better, and succeed faster.
articles.title: How AI Agents Are Transforming the Future of E-Commerce Automation

articles.author: Bridge Group Solutions
articles.description:
"Cloud or on-prem? Why not both?"
That‚Äôs what I said‚Ä¶ right before I nearly set my career on fire.
It started innocently enough: our CTO wanted the speed and flexibility of the cloud but couldn‚Äôt part with our on-prem infrastructure ‚Äî you know, the one we‚Äôd sunk years (and a criminal amount of money) into.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôll build a hybrid cloud,‚Äù they said.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be simple,‚Äù they said.
It wasn‚Äôt.
But it was worth it.
If you‚Äôre venturing into hybrid cloud territory and want to build something resilient ‚Äî not just duct-taped together with hope and curl scripts ‚Äî let me walk you through the minefield. I‚Äôve got scars, stories, and surprisingly, a working solution.
It lets you combine the control of on-premises systems with the agility and scalability of cloud platforms. But unlike a mullet, it can actu‚Ä¶
articles.title: Building Resilient Hybrid Cloud Architectures
